title: Israeli forces push deeper into Gaza as invasion expands, risks multiply
description: “We are at the height of war,” Israel’s Chief of Staff, Gen. Herzi Halevi, said Thursday as troops “surrounded” Gaza City, bringing new perils for civilians.

title: Lebanon, fearing wider war, awaits signals from Hezbollah’s leader
description: An expected speech by Hezbollah’s leader Hassan Nasrallah could give clues over whether the militant groups will expands attack on northern Israel.

title: David Kirke, first bungee jumper and extreme sports patriarch, dies at 78
description: As founder of the Dangerous Sports Club at Oxford, David Kirke orchestrated stunts including the first bungee jump and skiing down Swiss slopes on a grand piano.

title: Gaza becomes a ‘graveyard’ for children as Israel intensifies airstrikes
description: A child is killed every 10 minutes in Gaza, Save the Children says. Families are mourning not just their own losses, but what feels like the loss of an entire generation.

title: Dozens of U.S. citizens depart Gaza as Israel presses offensive
description: Some Americans said they were still encountering difficulties at the border, because the names of relatives were not on the list of those approved to exit.

title: Yuri Temirkanov, world-renowned conductor, dies at 84
description: He rebuilt the St. Petersburg Philharmonic after the collapse of communism and later led the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra.

title: In photos: Storm Ciarán lashes the U.K. after battering northwestern France
description: A storm that raged through northwestern France overnight was hitting Britain on Thursday with heavy rainfall and winds that prompted the country’s weather agency to issue its second-highest alert level for parts of southern England.

title: Why Egypt’s Rafah border crossing is vital for Gaza’s humanitarian crisis
description: The link between Egypt and Gaza is the only route for aid convoys to enter and foreign citizens to leave the besieged Palestinian enclave.

title: Storm Ciarán hits U.K. after battering France with strong winds, power cuts
description: Storm Ciarán moved through Britain after battering northwestern France, where it left more than a million homes without power.

title: As crisis unfolds in Gaza, Europe talks about tightening borders
description: Far-right voices have played up the possibility of mass migration from the Middle East, though few Palestinians have been able to leave.

title: Years into a climate disaster, these people are eating the unthinkable
description: In South Sudan, war and semi-permanent flooding have left people to scavenge for food, with long-term consequences for their health.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: Israel strikes Jabalya camp again; Americans expected to leave Gaza for Egypt
description: About 400 U.S. citizens, along with their family members, are expected to start leaving through the Rafah crossing into Egypt on Thursday, a U.S. official said.

title: In peace and war, these Ukrainian brothers bonded. Then death came.
description: Two Ukrainian brothers were inseparable. So when Russia invaded, they went to fight together. One family’s toll of war mirrors the grief of an entire nation.

title: Israel makes a desolation and may call it peace
description: Israeli officials and commentators are floating vague ideas of an endgame as Israel continues its punishing campaign in the Gaza Strip.

title: Australian woman arrested in suspected mushroom poisoning deaths
description: Three of four guests at Erin Patterson’s lunch in Leongatha died within a week of the meal. Authorities suspect they ate death cap mushrooms. No charges have been filed.

title: Tracking damage within the Gaza Strip through maps
description: Analysis of satellite imagery reveals the latest damage across Gaza since the start of the Israel-Gaza war.
